content.description: Short Solo or TR on the North End of the formation.  Start on the left edge of the face & follow the buckets to the top.  Walk off climber's left.
content.protection: no pro, solo it or TR

climbs.name: Wika
climbs.fa: Kelly Vaught, Frank Bentwood, Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Rebeca Russell, Wendall Smith

content.description: This face climb is near the right end of Brian's Crag.  3 bolts and rap station on top.
content.location: Near the right end, immediately right of a right-facing corner.

content.description:
Face moves to get up onto the same starting ledge as Unknown 739. Step left to go up a dogleg seam that straightens higher up with a nice vertical fin for its left lip along the crack. Finish via happy jugs. Located to adjacent left of Unknown 739, on the left side of the rightmost clump on the west side of Brian's Crag.

Anyone know its actual name and FA info?
content.protection: 3 rusty pins plus small to med cams, gear anchor.

content.description:
Up giant flat blocks to a slopey ledge to gain the vertical thin crack.  Much easier than it looks, and protects well with small cams.  Stretch up to reach patina jugs to gain another vertical thin crack that widens to hands.  Continue up and inward via easy scramble to the very top, or traverse left and up (more fun) across the underside of the frontside summit cap to finish atop Unknown 739.

Located between the flared crack of Unknown 739 to the left and the pillar of Escape From Wyoming to the right. This seems the best possibility that corresponds to the Unknown numbered 740 in JTree West, which states only a 5.7 rating and no other info.
This climb is just right of "Right Crack."  Start in a crack, traverse right, then up a wide crack.  There was no evidence that this was climbed before; if so, feel free to correct the F.A. & name.
content.location: North end of Brian's Crag, right of "Right Crack."

content.description: Face moves to get onto a big ledge, then a juggy overhanging sequence to reach a vertical flared crack that leads up to the top. This is the Unknown TR numbered 739 in the JTree West book.
Short solo. Go up a crack past a bush, then left up the face.

This climb ascends the prominent roof near the center of the West face of Brain's Crag.  Go up past a bolt to get into the right-facing corner of the roof.  Small pro possible here before reaching a second bolt under the roof. Step left onto the face, and climb past one more bolt to rap station.  Crux (for me) were the moves at the last bolt.  Roof goes easier than it looks.
content.protection: 3 bolts. Small pro possible in a couple of places. Rap Station on Top.
content.location: Around the center of the West face of Brain's Crag

content.description: This route lies just around the corner from the north shoulder routes.  Go up left crack, traverse right at a horizontal/small roof, then up a crack.  Going up the last crack is the crux. Rock is still a bit loose in places. Walk off climber's left of Windy Corner.
content.location: This climb is to the right of Right Crack.

content.description: This climbs a pillar-like formation to the right of the prominent roof (Over & Out) on the West Face of Brain's Crag.  6 nicely placed bolts and pro for horizontals makes this a well protected route. The rock is still a bit loose, but should clean up nicely with more ascents. Rap Station on top.
content.protection: 6 bolts, also can protect in horizontals with #3 BD cam and aliens for last horizontal. Rap Station on top.
content.location: To the right of the obvious roof climb on the West Face

climbs.name: Fah-Q
climbs.fa: FA: (lead) Todd Gordon, Kelly Vaught, Frank Bentwood

content.description: Another fine route by Todd & Co.  This "gym-type" climb is on the south side of Brian's Crag. Pumpy/bouldery start, 3 bolts and a fixed pin.  Bolt anchor on top.  Walk off climber's right, or walk to rap Station on Wika.  Positive holds at the start.  A 1" cam may be placed in the crack at the end, but not necessary.
content.protection: 3 bolts, one pin at the start.

content.description: Up the left side of a pillar, leading up to ledgy recess, then step up left to the summit.  Located to adjacent right of Unknown 740, on the right side of the rightmost clump on the west side of Brian's Crag.

climbs.name: Diddly Squat
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Patty Kline, January 2015

content.description:
Climb the face between Windy Corner and right crack, just left of center.

Nice moves, incut holds and great rock- it's a shame it's so short; 200 feet of this stuff would be one of the best routes in Josh.
content.protection: CDs from 1.5 to 4 inches and a rigging rope for the toprope anchor.

climbs.name: The Da Vinci Code
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Tim Pinar

content.description: 1 bolt, 1 fixed beak, leads to a slot (crux) and a 2 bolt anchor. Far left side of Brian's Crag
content.protection: a few QDs for the fixed stuff, and a small rack of sm to med stuff.
content.location: Far left side of Brian's Crag.

content.description: Flared short grainy looking crack to right of Wika.Nothing on MP or any guide books about this climb.  Happy to update with original FA info if known and name of climb
content.protection: Gear to 2".  Flared in most of the sections
content.location: Rap using Wika bolted anchor.  Climb is to right of Wika found on MP and Todd Gordon's guidebook

content.description: Obvious right-facing dihedral to immediate left of the light gray bolts on the Wika slab face.  Found no documentation of this in the guidebooks.  Might as well give it a name.  Happy to update with original FA info if known.
content.protection: Pro to 3.5", bolted rap anchor atop Wika.
content.location: Rap using Wika bolted anchor, or walk off backside.
